In June 1998 Senator Leahy said:
 
 "I have stated over and over again ... that I would object and fight against any filibuster on a judge, whether it is somebody I opposed or supported." 
 
 Take a look and see who supports the filibuster against Miguel Estrada:
 
 http://www.cfif.org/htdocs/legislative_issues/federal_issues/hot_issues_in_congress/confirmation_watch/filibuster_miguel_votes.htm

post_info.post_title: The Liberal Lie on the Senate Floor

This should XXXX everyone off, both Democrat and Republican, both liberal and conservative. Judicial approval should be based on qualifications, ethics, and honesty, not a political agenda.
 
 Judges are political appointiees, granted, but his filibuster threatens the stability of our Consitution.
 
 My $.02
Why are they blocking this? I haven't heard anyone actually say why.

Brother, check out all the news services. Read them all then decide for yourself. If you come to the same conclusion as I have, then you will be scared and XXXXXX. This filibuster has very grave implications for the stability of our democracy if it is successful. It has very grave implications already just the fact they tried it.

Republicans have been accused of doing the very same thing. Senator Richard J. Durbin said, "...dozens of President Clinton's nominees were denied their chance to serve on the bench by the Republican Senate even though they were clearly qualified, and even though they held centrist, moderate, and mainstream views."
 http://judiciary.senate.gov/oldsite/rd072401f.htm
 
 Is it just politics?
It is just politics, but how often do you catch a Senator in a bold face lie on the record.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  The Liberal Lie on the Senate Floor
